org.magnos.trie

Interface TrieSequencer<S>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - The sequence type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TrieSequencerByteArray, TrieSequencerByteBuffer, TrieSequencerCharArray, TrieSequencerCharArrayCaseInsensitive, TrieSequencerCharSequence, TrieSequencerCharSequenceCaseInsensitive, TrieSequencerIntArray, TrieSequencerLongArray, TrieSequencerShortArray

    public interface TrieSequencer<S>
    A TrieSequencer enables a Trie to use keys of type S. A sequence is a linear set of elements.
    Author:
    Philip Diffenderfer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int hashOf(S sequence, int index)
      Calculates the hash of the element at the given index in the given sequence.
      int lengthOf(S sequence)
      Calculates the length (number of elements) of the given sequence.
      int matches(S sequenceA, int indexA, S sequenceB, int indexB, int count)
      Determines the maximum number of elements that match between sequences A and B where comparison starts at the given indices up to the given count.

    • Method Detail

      • matches

        int matches(S sequenceA,
            int indexA,
            S sequenceB,
            int indexB,
            int count)
        Determines the maximum number of elements that match between sequences A and B where comparison starts at the given indices up to the given count.
        Parameters:
        sequenceA - The first sequence to count matches on.
        indexA - The offset into the first sequence.
        sequenceB - The second sequence to count matches on.
        indexB - The offset into the second sequence.
        count - The maximum number of matches to search for.
        Returns:
        A number between 0 (inclusive) and count (inclusive) that is the number of matches between the two sequence sections.

      • lengthOf

        int lengthOf(S sequence)
        Calculates the length (number of elements) of the given sequence.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence to measure.
        Returns:
        The length of the given sequence.

      • hashOf

        int hashOf(S sequence,
           int index)
        Calculates the hash of the element at the given index in the given sequence. The hash is used as a key for the PerfectHashMap used internally in a Trie to quickly retrieve entries. Typical implementations based on characters return the ASCII value of the character, since it yields dense numerical values. The more dense the hashes returned (the smaller the difference between the minimum and maximum returnable hash means it's more dense), the less space that is wasted.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence.
        index - The index of the element to calculate the hash of.
        Returns:
        The hash of the element in the sequence at the index.
